docs.text: Servless What problems it solves well * Provision of infrastructure that might not be used often * Need to patch infrastructure manually when there's updates What are the known challenges What it should not be used for What is the role of each of the stakeholders Developer Write code that's built on triggers PM Cost estimation is based on consumption so need to measure consumption What it is CP allocates all the infrastructure that costs nothing while not used. It's event driven in which you write code/programs that run based on events and consume services Bunch of managed services that scale to zero compared to containers that can scale down to one while using container orchestration Software can be setup with no operational responsibility Eg situation Functions are the pieces of code that spin up when the event is triggered function might add something to a database and once added, that might trigger another function Beyond db...a SPA can be in blob storage that returns html/js by calling functions that call databases Questions you have... How good is the performance? How many functions is too much? What if there's down time? If someone is handling insfrasture, someone is fixing it as well... How do you do identity management? - like..hit COR and get info? What about memory management? Will that scale for each function? Or is it about writing a small function?
